item.title: Week 5: This time with galaxies
item.dc:creator: astrojansen
item.description: What I completed this last week: Nearly finished the empirical spectrum -> synthetic photometry tutorial for a high H-alpha emission galaxy. This example can be seen here. As you can see from the 1-1 plot at the end of the tutorial, the predicted photometry does not perform as well compared to the 1 ...READ MORE...

item.title: Week 4: SkyCalc and SVO and tynt oh my
item.dc:creator: astrojansen
item.description: What I completed this last week: Successfully queried from the SVO filter database for our tutorial’s throughput models. This inspired Brett to write a package called tynt, a “super lightweight package containing approximate transmittance curves for more than five hundred astronomical filters”, whic ...READ MORE...

item.title: Week 3: Querying progress
item.dc:creator: astrojansen
item.description: What I completed last week: Made a separate git repo for my GSoC related work. This will make it easier to track changes, make suggestions, etc Edited the first tutorial such that: The only data files left in notebook are the CCD quantum efficiency table. item.title: Updates and a second to-do list
item.dc:creator: astrojansen
item.description: We’ve made some headway with the synphot tutorial, which has helped us determine what to do next. This is what we’ve done so far: To get more accurate count rates, we: Add effects by atmospheric attentuation by using the Cerro Paranal model transmittance curves for an airmass of 1.5 Consider the eff ...READ MORE...

item.title: git… y u do dis
item.dc:creator: astrojansen
item.description: So I’m new to github. And not gonna lie, I feel a little ashamed about it. To me it’s always been one of those things that only the super impressive graduate students know how to use and navigate, but it just never stuck for me. Hence my embarrassingly grey contribution array. Fetching, pushing, pul ...READ MORE...

item.title: Hello, World!
item.dc:creator: astrojansen
item.description: Ah, “Hello World,” the classic opening. Today my mentors and I held Meeting 0, where we introduced ourselves and began sketching our way forward with the development of telescopy. Mainly we brainstormed what to do during the GSoC “Community Bonding Period” and came up with a nice to-do list for me t ...READ MORE...
